direction.raw_text: . DAWN A series of fast-cut static scenes of empty streets. DAVID (VOICE-OVER) This could have been any city: they're all the same. A rapid, swerving track along deserted streets and down narrow lanes and passageways. Accompanied by soundtrack and credits. The track ends outside a solid, fashionable Edinburgh tenement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY At the door of a flat on the third floor of the tenement. The door is dark, heavy wood and on it is a plastic card embossed with the names of three tenants. They are Alex Law, David Stevens, and Juliet Miller. A man climbs the stairs and reaches the door. He is Cameron Clarke, thin and in his late twenties with a blue anorak and lank, greasy hair. He is carrying an awkwardly bulky plastic bag. Cameron gives the doorbell an ineffectual ring and then stands back, shifting nervously from foot to foot until the door is answered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, I've come about the room. Cameron enters and the door closes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David, Alex, and Juliet sit in a line on the sofa directly opposite Cameron, who shifts uneasily in his armchair. Alex checks some items on a clipboard before speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- Campbell or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cameron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cameron?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Juliet) Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Cameron) What? Cameron is not sure what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Cameron, are you comfortable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Well, you've seen the flat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, it's great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It is, isn't it? We alllike it. And the room's nice too, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spacious, quiet, bright, well appointed, all that sort of stuff, all that crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me, Cameron, what on earth -- just tell me, because I want to know -- what on earth could make you think that we would want to share a flat like this with someone like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY As Cameron plods slowly down the stairs, his shoes striking out against the stone steps, Alex's criticisms continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, my first impression, and they're rarely wrong, is that you have none of the qualities that we would normally seek in a prospective flatmate. I'm talking here about things like presence, charisma, style and charm, and I don't think we're being unreasonable. Take David here, for instance: a chartered accountant he may be, but at least he tries hard. The point is, I don't think you're even trying. Cameron has reached the bottom of the stairs. He opens the main door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, Cameron -- I mean this -- good luck! Cameron leaves and the main door closes behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think he was upset?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Inside the hall of the flat, David approaches the door toopen it. Freeze-frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David likes to keep spareshoelaces in sorted pairs in a box marked, not just shoelaces', but spare shoelaces'. David opens the door to the Woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come to see about the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Outside the door of the flat a young Goth girl, aged about twenty, rings the doorbell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Inside the hall of the flat Alex approaches the door to open it. Freeze-frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex is a vegetarian. Do you know why? Because he feels it provides an interesting counterpoint to his otherwise callous personality. It doesn't. He thinks he's the man for me. He isn't, though there was a time when, well, there was a time when... Alex opens the door to the Goth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come about the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY At the door of the flat a Man aged about thrity-five rings the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Inside the hall of the flat Juliet approaches the door to open it. Freeze-frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like one of those stupid posters -- you know, a gorilla cuddling a hedgehog, caption love hurts --- that's what I think when I think of Juliet. Juliet opens the door to the Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come about the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY In the living room each of the candidates is interviewed individually with the same seating arrangements as before (i.e. the trio on the sofa and the applicant on the chair). What we see are briskly intercut excerpts from each of these interviews. We do not get the responses to the questions, although we may see some facial reaction. All of David's questions are to the Woman. All of Alex's questions are to the Goth. All of Juliet's questions are to the Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, just a few questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to ask you about your hobbies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you want a room here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you slaughter a goat and wrench its heart out with your bare hands, do you then summon hellfire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, what are you actually doing here? What is the hidden agenda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do a little freebasemaybe, from time to time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or maybe just phone out for a pizza?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, it's a fairly straightforward question. You're either divorced or you're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to play you just a few seconds of this tape -- I'd like you to name the song, the lead singer and the three hit singles subsequently recorded by him with another band.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you get up in the morning, how do you decide what shade of black to wear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, let me get this straight. This affair that you're not having, is it not with a man or not with a woman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning very briefly to the subject of corporate finance -- no, this is important. Leveraged buy-outs -- a good thing or a bad thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With which of the following figures do you most closely identify: Joan of Arc, Eva Braun or Marilyn Monroe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just that you strike me as a man trapped in a crisis of emotional direction, afflicted by a realization that the partner of your dreams is, quite simply, just that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever kill a man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when did anyone last say to you these exact words: You are the sunshine of my life'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: so A has left you, B is ambivalent, you're still seeing C but D is the one you yearn for. What are we to make of this? If I were you, I'd ditch the lot. There's a lot more letters in the alphabet of love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if I told you that I was the antichrist?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING In a sports centre Juliet sits outside a glass-walled squash court. She is ready to play, but at present is watching Alex and David, who are inside the court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Inside the squash court, Alex is about to serve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squash is often used as a metaphor to represent a struggle for personal domination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was trying to educate you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just serve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the same fashion as chess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chess. Chess is often used as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you shut up and play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a bad loser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't lost yet. Alex serves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING The squash-court door opens and David walks out past Juliet as Alex stands behind, jabbing his finger at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defeat, defeat, defeat-- sporting,personal, financial, professional, sexual, everything. Next. Juliet walks in and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Inside the squash court Alex is about to serve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know -- JULIET Just serve. Alex serves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex sits in the back, drinking. Juliet is driving. David sits beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't trying to win. There is no response from Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to devalue your victory, but I just want you to know: I wasn't trying to win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victory is the same as defeat. It's giving in to destructive competitive urges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You learn that in your psychotherapy group?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Discussion group, Alex, discussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you stopped going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he had one too many of thise urges. You of all people should know that. Alex leans close to Juliet. Juliet brakes abruptly and, as Alex flies forward, elbows him in the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, you two are sensitive. All I'm doing is implying some sort of sordid, ugly, sexual liason. Why, I'd be proud of that sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should go, Alex.You'll meet someone wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For my life? At a discussion group? I think not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Be someone else like him. One is enough. And what happened to that girl, that friend of yours, the one that came round. I liked her. I really felt we had something. She could have moved in. We had chemistry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hated you -- ALEX Well, she had problems -- JULIET -- more than anyone she has ever met. In her whole life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be the first topoint that out. In all kindness I would. But, like they say, you know, she's got to want to change, hasn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Outside the door of the flat Hugo rings the bell and waits. Juliet opens the door. Hugo is in his early thirties, tall, dark and bohemian in appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Hugo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be delighted. Hugo walks in and Juliet closes the door quite deliberately behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo looks around, pleased at what he sees, while Juliet watches him. He sits on the edge of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to see the rest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo is seated on the sofa, Juliet sits opposite on an armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've been away for a bit, travelling, that sort of thing, and now I'm trying to write a novel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A priest who dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Well, maybe I'll change it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I mean, who wants to read about another dead priest? It's about some other guy, some guy who's not a priest, who doesn't die. You see, it's better already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Writing seems easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a breeze. The telephone begins to ring out in the hall. Juliet does not move and at first says nothing. Hugo looks at her and towards the door leading to the hall. After several rings, Juliet speaks. JULIET Do you think you could answer that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The telephone? It continues to ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the telephone, but if it's for me, I'm not in. HUGO You're not in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Hugo stands up. The ringing continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo lifts the phone. He turns to face Juliet and looks her in the eye as he lies on her behalf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Yes. Who's calling please? Well, I'm sorry, but she's not in right now. I don't know. Would you like to leave a message? Hugo replaces the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was some guy called Brian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he sound upset?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little bit. Is that good or bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an improvement. The telephone begins to ring again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall I answer it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just leave it. He knows I must be at home. I'm working nights this week. The telephone continues to ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working nights?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he's a patient of yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But he needs treatment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A certain weakness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The human condition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I write about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's not the same thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but like all novelists, I'm in search of the self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING Juliet, dressed and fatigued, sits at the table sipping a coffee. Alex is also seated at the table, but wearing an old dressing- gown and munching at cornflakes while he reads a newspaper and talks at the same time. An array of other papers is spread over the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has he tried down the back of the fridge? I mean, that's where I normally find things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seemed like a nice guy, Alex. Juliet gets up and leaves the kitchen. The soundof a bath running is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying he didn't seem like a nice guy. All I'm saying is, it's a bit strange, and this search for the self, and what he's on about, you know. Alex hears the mail falling through the door and stands up to leave the kitchen and get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling from outside) He didn't seem strange, Alex.He seemed, you know -- INT. BATHROOM.MORNING. Juliet watches the bath fill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING Alex considers her reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interesting. Interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING Alex is walking through the hall to the door,muttering interesting' to himself. As he passes the phone starts to ring. He stops and lifts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. No, she's not in. No. No. No. No ideas. Alex replaces the reciever and walks on to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from the bathroom) Who was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He sounded Swedish. Do you know any Swedish men? Maybe it was just the emotion. Alex picks up the mail and looks through it. As he does so,David emerges from his room, dressed for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About this guy, this Hugo person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only asking what you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have time to discuss it now. I don't care so long as he's not a freak. David opens the door. Alex hands him an envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for you. It's your mother's handwriting, so I didn't open it. I don't like reading about your father's constipation. David snatches the letter and leaves, closing the door. Alex walks back across the hall, opening one of the letters and reading it quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling from the bathroom) So we'll meet him, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Oh, yeah, sure, if you want. I tell you, every letter this guy writes to you is the same: they all begin like pure love and descend into open pornography. I dream of your thighs, the soft touch of your white skin leading me in desire, while I, aroused and inflamed --' Juliet's hand and arm appear around the bathroom door. She attempts to grab the letter. Alex plays at holding the letter just beyond her reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aroused and inflamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He even signs them, in his own name, can you believe it? I'd sign someone else's name. I'd sign his name. If I wrote them, that is. Which I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Alex, David, Juliet and Hugo sit round a table towards the end of a meal. Alcohol has been consumed. Bowls containing the last of the food sit on the table, being picked at occassionally. Alex dispenses wine mainly into his own glass, alternating with Macallan malt whisky, of which he pours generous amounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, that's what she said. Interesting. That's why you're here, you see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Normally I don't meet people, unless I know them already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People can be so cruel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were going to say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was I trying to say? Oh, yes, I think, we think, or at least I suppose we think -- am I right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get on with it, Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it going, Alex. You're unstoppable now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We think it's fine. Alex starts eating again. The others watch him expectantly. David coughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's OK. There's no problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean I can have the room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's what I said, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He made it clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, thank you, David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you can have the room. Alex pours yet more alcohol.

direction.raw_text: I'm not usually drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not usually this drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only on expenses.

direction.raw_text: It's true. A newspaper is paying for all this. A newspaper... With exaggerated scorn, Alex knocks over a glass of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a moment he's going to tell he could have been someone -- ALEX It was you, Juliet, it was you -- JULIET -- instead of what he is -- ALEX What I am.

direction.raw_text: which is -- ALEX -- which is a hack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man we know and love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A miserable, burnt-out, empty shell of a -- Alex pauses, looks at his drink, then at Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know and love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, they don't really know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Alex, we don't really love you. Alex smiles at Juliet and drinks again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you afford this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Hugo reaches into his pocket and pulls out a thick bundle of notes, which he places in front of Alex. Alex leans over and sniffs the notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you a question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever killed a man? HUGO No.

direction.raw_text: Well, that's fair enough, then. Alex raises his head.

direction.raw_text: Certainly smells like the real thing.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT At a cash dispenser a man in his thrities is taking out some money. A younger man, Andy, stands besdie him, looking around in a mildly agitated fashion. As the money emerges, Andy assaults and robs the man. He starts by smashinf the victim's face repeatedly against the cash dispenser until the Perspex is smeared with blood. When he has final finished and the man lies on the ground, Andy takes the money and the card from the slots, then gets into a car which has pulled up alongside, driven by Tim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo climbs the stairs, carrying two suitcases. He stops at the door of the flat and looks at a bunch of keys before selecting one, which he inserts in the door.

direction.raw_text: . DAY Inside the flat. The door opens and Hugolifts his cases in, kicking the door closed behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Juliet sleeps, undisturbed by the closing of the door.

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo walks across the halland disappears into his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo unpackshis bags. Included in his things are a few syringes and needles. All these he puts into the drawer beside his bed. He checks inside a second bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hugo dails a number on the telephone and awaits a reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Juliet is woken by her alarm clock. The time is five p.m.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex sits watching television, constantly changing channels. Juliet walks in, wearing a dressing gown. She watches Alex for a few moments.

direction.raw_text: Have you seen Hugo?

direction.raw_text: . MORNING The telephone is ringing. Alex lifts up the reciever. Again he is wearing his dressing gown and is on his way to pick up the mail.

direction.raw_text: No, she's not in. Without waiting for any more, he replaces the reciever and walks to the door, where he picks up the mail. On his way back from the door, David emerges, ready to go to work.

direction.raw_text: Alex, I don't have the time -- ALEX Yes or no, yes or no, yes or -- DAVID No. David leaves, slamming the door.

direction.raw_text: . MORNING Alex returns to the kitchen, pausing only to knock at Hugo's door, which elicits no response. In the kitchen Juliet sits dressed for work, having just returned. He casually opens an envelope and glances at both sides of the letter before handing it to her.

direction.raw_text: David hasn't seen him either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I gathered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he didn't like us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hugo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His car's still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got a car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's wrong with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sort of car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, how shouldI know? I'm just a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will ask you once more, what sort of car -- JULIET A blue one, OK. And it's still there.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT We see the door to Hugo's room, then Alex rapping sharply against it. David and Juliet stand behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hugo. Hugo. Sorry about this, but can you open the door? It's us, Hugo, your flatmates and companions. Your new-found friends. He's not in. He's left and we'll probably never see him again.

direction.raw_text: Alex, the key is in the keyhole on the other side.

direction.raw_text: So?

direction.raw_text: Open it.

direction.raw_text: Now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Inside Hugo's room we see the door as David, outside, throws himself against it. At the third attempt the lock gives way and the door bursts open. In the foreground at one side is the bed with a naked foot lying still and exposed. When the door is open, David is first in, followed by the other two. There is a period of silent shock as they contemplate Hugo's naked corpse. Alex opens a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this what they always look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Juliet drapes a sheet over the body, covering it completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder how he did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder how he killed himself. I presume that that's what happened. What do you think? Quite casually, Alex begins to open drawers and cupboards, emptying the contents on to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What's wrong?
