direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? What's wrong, Juliet? Aren't you curious? Don't you wonder what he died from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.The guy's dead.What more do you need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not every day I find a story in my own flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thats not a story, Alex. It's a corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old newspaper proverb says dead human being is living story. Be rational, please, and failing that be quiet. In a drawer in a bedside cabinet, Alex finds needles, syringes and a small bag of powder. Without comment, he holds it up and throws it on the bed. He reaches under the bed and pulls out a case, which he opens. It is empty and he pushes it back under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen a dead body before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, I think it's time for you to stop. Alex continues to search. Juliet walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet stands alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex continues his brisk search through Hugo's posesseions while David looks on, appalled but speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet listens to the sounds from the bedroom, then picks up the telephone. She dials 999 and waits for a reply. It rings and rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex has found and opened a large Gladstone bag. Neither David norwe can see into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw my grandmother, of course, but I don't suppose that counts. I mean, she was alive at the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I show you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet awaits an answer. Alex approaches Juliet with the open bag. She turns around and looks into it, then, seeing the contents, she replaces the receiver. As she does so, the Operator's voice is audible for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, emergency services. The telephone hits the cradle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David, Alex and Juliet are seated in silence around the tabel. The bag, stacked with money, lies open on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juliet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Alex. It's, it's -- ALEX What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfeasible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean immoral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only asking you both to think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's asick idea, Alex. It's sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But don't tell me that you're not tempted by it. Don't tell me that you're not interested. I know you well enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, then, go ahead, telephone. Telephone the police. Try again. No one's going to stand in your way. Go ahead. Tell them there's a suitcase of money and you don't want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING The flat is silent. Footsteps are heard outside the door and mail falls through the letter box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The living room, empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The kitchen, empty. The bag of money still sits on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY His corpse lies on the bed, covered as before, incompletely, by a sheet, with parts of his body still showing (a foot, a hand, part of his face or abdomen).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The open-plan office of a busy newspaper. Alex sits at his desk. He is talking on a telephone jammed against his shoulder and while he does so he is casually acknowledging and waving at colleagues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, was there a pet in the house? Yes, a pet, like a dog or a budgie or a gerbil. You see, what I need is PC Plod rescues Harry the Hamster from House of Horror'. All right... well, that's a pity, you see, no pets, no human angle. Alex hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Another view of the body: for example, from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY In the accident and emeregency department of a busy hospital, Juliet sifts through a setof casenotes. Another Doctor approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, there. Juliet does not look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to that guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That guy, the one that died. Juliet looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What guy that died?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one, last week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here?.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, here, I mean, where else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, him. Well, he died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The body, stillpresent, exposed and motionless. The curtain flutters by the open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Lumsden, a middle-aged chartered accountant, isseated in a largechair behind a desk. He is talking to David,who appears distracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do here, David?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's a wide range of, eh -- LUMSDEN Accounting, David, chartered accounting -- DAVID Exactly what I was -- LUMSDEN -- is often sneered at. Are you aware of that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not any real sneering as such, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a whole wide world out there, and it all needs to be accounted for, doesn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh -- LUMSDEN But they sneer, don't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure -- LUMSDEN Oh, it's unfashionable, I know, but, yes, we're methodical, yes, we're dilligent, yes, we're serious, and where's the crime in that, and why not shout it from the rooftops, yes, maybe sometimes we are a little bit boring, but by God, we get the job done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's why I think you fit in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm boring?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get the job done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see, I thought you meant -- LUMSDEN Which is why I'm trusting you with this account. Lumsden throws a heavy folder into David's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING It is almost dark.Only the familiar contour is visible through the gloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING David ascends the stairs to the flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Alex sits in an armchair facing out of the window. Juliet stands facing into the room. David, the last home, appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't get his car started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When are you going to let the police know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call them if you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Juliet) And what about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm getting used to having him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The corpse as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David sits at his desk, looking across the office. Crouched over a large array of other desks, young men and women in suits are pouring over folders and columned books. No one is speaking except in muted tones on the telephones. David watches them. He looks to his left and to his right: on either side young men like him are toiling over accounts. He turns and looks behind him, where another array of accountants sit. He turns back to his desk and opens the file he was previously given. He looks at the columns of records of profit, with a large total at the bottom. When David looks up he sees Juliet seated beside his desk. She smiles and directs his gaze, with her own, to the surrounding scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING The body in silhouette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK. Let's do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Inside a large, brightly lit DIY store with Muzak playing in the background. We start with a tracking shot along an aisle stacked with potentially vicious tools.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, now listen. We have to dispose of the body in such a way as to make it unidentifiable, so that even if it is found, then it's never anything more than an unknown corpse. Burning, dumping at sea, and straightforward burial are all flawed either by fingerprints, or, more commonly, by dental records. This I have learned. Now, what I suggest is that we bury him out in the forest, but first of all we remove his hands and his feet, which we incinerate. And his teeth, which we just remove. It's as simple as that. As the tracking shot ends, we see David's head and shoulders as he looks at something off picture. Suddenly a spring-loaded screwdriver appears and is fired' so that the tip stops a few millimeters from his face. David winces as we see that Alex is holding it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always wondered what these were for. Alex places the screwdriver down on the shelf and walks across the aisle to pick up a saw and a hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now this is what we need. And this. Alex hands the tools to David, who looks at them with disgust. Alex walks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what else? DAVID I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A spade, we need a spade -- I wish you would concentrate -- we need a spade if we're going to dig a pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who's going to do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dig the pit, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what? Who's going to do what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I'm talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I? What? What? What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what. Who's going to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all are, David, we're all going to do it. Each of us, you, me and Juliet, will do his or her bit. Is that fair enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't hear this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be able to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're telling me you want out? Already? You're telling me you don't want the money? Hugo is going off. He smells. The flat smells. We can't wait any longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just telling you I can't cut him up. Alex turns away in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Late at night, in a quiet lane at the back of the flat, a hired Ford Transit is parked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Inside the dimly lit van, Alex and Juliet are laying down plastic on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's going to do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we all were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't thinkI can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're a doctor. You kill people every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to. It's different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now you tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A Man's face is being held under water. Bubbles escape from his mouth and his eys bulge. Tim hauls the Man's head out of the bath. His legs and arms are bound with cord. Andy sits on a chair, watching. Tim ducks the Man's head under the water again. The Man's face as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT We see Hugo's face just before Alex, David and Juliet wrap him in a sheet and thick, black plastic. They wear masks over their noses. The smell is making them uncomfortable and irritable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I want to ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The Man's head has just been lifted from the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I swear to God, I don't know. Tim ducks the Man's head back under the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT ALEX (angry through his mask) Family? Family? Friends? Drugged-up wandering suicidal search of the self fuck-ups don't have families, David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought we should discuss it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take his legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In the stairwell of the flat, grunts of effort are heard as Alex, David and Juliet struggle with the heavy corpse, carrying it down the stairs wrapped in plastic sheeting. They come into view and go down the stairs. They are all very tense and freeze with panic after accidentally banging against another flat's door. They swear at one another and continue theri descent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Tim is ducking the Man again. He writhes and struggles but is powerless to stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The back yard and back door of the flats. The door opens and Alex, David and Juliet emerge, carrying the corpse out towards the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT From the landing we can see along the floor into the bathroom. The Man's legs extend away from the bath. They are completely still. Andy and Tim stand beside them, looking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stupid bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Inside the back of the empty van. The door is opened and the body is half slid and half thrown inside. The door is closed and in the dark interior, the outline of the plastic lump is just visible, thanks to a streetlight. One of the doors opens again and David throws a bag of tools in. He then closes and locks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In front of the van, David is climbing into the passenger side. Juliet and Alex are already in, with the latter at the wheel. Alex turns to the other two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we just draw lots for it? The other two remain silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever draws the short straw does it all. That way, you either do it or you don't. All or nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, if I draw the short straw, then I'll do it, but I'm not going to do it just because you won't. Alex starts the engine of the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Through the darkness we hear an engine, then the headlights of the van come into view. It pulls off the track onto a patch of grass. The engine is switched off but the light remains on. The trio descend from the van. In fron of the van, Alex, illuminated by its lights, Alex, David and Juliet stand together. Alex is showing them two long stems of grass and one short one. He encloses them in his fist and holds them out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, then, here we are and this is it. Do you want to play or not? Alex holds his hand out towards Juliet, who takes the tip of one of the stems. It is one of the larger ones. Alex and Juliet turn to David. Alex holds out the stems. David reaches out and takes one of the tips. It is the short straw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Deeper in the forest, with the headlamps still casting a little light throught the trees, we see David's head and shoulders. His right arm is moving briskly back and forth accompanied by a vicious sawing noise. The sawing stops as he evidently finished with one extremity. He shuffles back and starts sawing at another. Alex leans against the spade in a shallow pit that he has dug. He observes David impassively. The sawing stops again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not quite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that going to be deep enough? Alex bends down to pick up the hammer, which he holds out towards David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you worry about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this necessary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Now come on, all or nothing. Most reluctantly, David takes the hammer and looks at Alex, who gestures as if to say, "On you go.' With revulsion on his face, he raises the hammer above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David's face is visible against the plain white backdrop of his pillow. He lies fully clothed on his bed, looking up at the ceiling. There is a knock at the door, then Juliet walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without looking at Juliet) Oh, yes, I'm fine, thanks, just fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to talk about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Alex sits with his feet up watching a noisy game show, while eating a snack and drinking from a can of beer. Newspapers lie scattered at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The loft above the flat in darkness, but the trapdoor is opened, letting in a pool of light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David is pulling himself through the trapdoor up into the loft. Beneath him is a stepladder. Juliet stands half-way up the ladder, while Alex stands on the floor beside it. As David enters the loft, Alex hands up the bag of money to Juliet, who passes it on up to David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we don't want another stiff on our hands. Don't fall through the ceiling. OK? Is he listening to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop nagging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) I don't know why we couldn't stuff it in a mattress or put it under the floor like any normal human being. We could have hid it in the fridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David moves on into the dark cavernous loft, edging his way across beams and pipes. There are no skylights. He stops and leans against some structure (the water tank). He strains to see in the darkness. Suddenly there is a loud sucking and flowing noise as water empties from the water tank. David is startled and steps forward, tripping. He reaches out as he falls, striking a light switch. Briefly the loft is illuminated: David blinking as he lies across some beams, the large cavernous area, the pipes, the water tank, the bag of money lying between two rafters, and then the old brass switches beginning to spark and the light goes out. David scrambles towards the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Now clean and empty, with no trace of recent habitation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY In a basement corridor in the hospital, pipes run along the ceiling. Above a fenced-off area is a sign saying For Incineration Only -- No Aerosols'. On the floor of this area are yellow plastic sacks. Juliet appears around a corner carrying one of these. Quite casually the clumps it on the pile and continues past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING Alex pushes a blue car into a quary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In the garage there is a car, gardening equipment, several sacks of fertilizer and a trunk-style deep freeze, on the lid of which sit Andy and Tim. Tim takes out a cigarette and offers one to Andy, who declines. They slide off the deep freeze and open it. Inside the freezer there is a man, naked and bound with cord. They lift him up. He is very cold and weak. The Man begins to whisper inaudibly. Andy moves his head so that he can hear the whisper. He listens, then nods approvingly. They push him down again and close the lid. Andy holds the lid while Tim dumps the sacks of fertilizer on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex, David and Juliet are attending a charity ball. Everyone is dressed very smartly, in ball gowns and black ties with the addition of a significant number of kilts. Neither Alex nor David wears a kilt. The trio seem to know a number of people there but do not seem especially keen to speak to them. A middle-aged, podgy, mustachioed Master of Ceremonies is standing on a platform in front of the band, making a speech to the diners who are still sat at their tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen, may I have your attention please. First of all, may I thank you all for coming along tonight and supporting our appeal to raise funds for the sick children's unit. There is a quick drum roll and applause breaks out. We move to the table where Alex, David and Juliet are seated. Alex leans across to Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't tell me that this was for children. I hate children. I'd raise money to have the little fuckers put down. Some other guests around the table cast critical glances at Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sshh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want my money back. Excuse me. Alex signals to the waiter by lifting his hand and snapping his fingers, then indicates another bottle of champagne that already ists in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For all too often there's a complacency: out of sight, out of mind, let someone else bother about these things. Alex cheers once and starts to applaud on his own. Juliet nudges him viciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But just before the dancing, I'd like to say a special thank-you to a few of the people who've worked so very hard to make this occassion happen. The MC's drone continues in the background while conversation continues back at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know many of these people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. They're my friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see, so if they want to talk to you, we say you're not in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now, ladies and gentlemen, and those of you who are neither or both -- Drum roll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- would you make your way to the floor for Strip the Willow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we going to dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's physical contact, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The dance floor a few minutes later. It is packed and rather chaotic. Sweaty, dishevelled dancers sling one another around, with the thud of flesh against flesh. Toes are stood on and jackets discarded. Juliet dances with Alex, who plunges in with the maximum of violence, eventually tripping up and tumbling forcefully among the other dancers. He starts to get up, then rests his head back against the floor. David has not been dancing. Instead he remains at their table and at the bar, drinking steadily and watching the other two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Back at the table, while most people are still on the dnace floor, the trio sit drinking and Alex smokes a cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we talk about something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now. I have an idea. Alex pours champagne on to a stack of glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, it's important. We need to talk about what we're going to do -- ALEX Just stop worrying. Alex stands and raises his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love and happiness for ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For ever and ever. Alex drinks, then puts his glass down. Juliet drinks but does not drain her glass. David sits still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After you drink to love and happiness forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David, I promise we will. Keep him happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not for me. It's for love and happiness forever. David reaches out to take his glass. Suddenly, Alex flings an arm out to point, knocking over David's glass and completely losing interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look over there. It's Cameron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cameron. You remember Cameron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it is. It's him. Cameron, Cameron, come on over.Yo! From some distance away, Cameron becomes aware of Alex and cautiously makes his way across until he stands a few feet from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. We thought you were someone else. Alex falls forward, laughing, and the other two also laugh as Cameron walks away, humiliated again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck. I love that guy, but why does he have to follow us around?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, what I was wanting to say was this -- BRIAN (UNSEEN) The divine Juliet. Long time no see. Brian approaches and is standing behind their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you care to dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on there. Who do you think you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think you are? You interrupted us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Brian McKinley, and who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Brian McKinley, if you want to talk to my girlfriend, you talk to me first. If you want to dance with her, then you apply in writing three weeks in advance or you're gonna end up insode a fucking bin-bag. You didn't apply, so you don't dance. Shocked and frightened, Brian backs away, then turns around to complete his departure. Juliet restrains David with a touch as they watch him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think you could be a little more forceful next time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright. I think he got the message anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was stressful. I found that stressful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but you were good, you were really good. Fucking bin-bag', I liked that. You were good. You explored your maleness to the full there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you certainly had a good look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were magnificent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The gents' toilet. Brightly-lit and white-tiled. Alex walk in and goes into a cubicle and closes the door. We hear him whistling and laughing as he passes urine. He keeps muttering bin-bag' to himself. Then he flushes the toilet and opens the door. As he does so a look of surprise appears on his face as he sees someone waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cameron! What a surprise. As Alex is speaking Cameron's fist flies forward, hitting him in the face and sending him flying backwards. Cameron enters the cubicle and closes the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING Mail falls through the letter box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING. Alex does not stir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING David emerges from his room, ready for his work. He looks towards the kitchen, then walks to the door and opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING We hear the main door closing as David leaves. Alex jolts with energy with every sound. The telephone begins to ring. Juliet looks at Alex expectantly, but he does not move. Eventually she gets up and answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. No one said anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rendered speechless with desire. I recall that feeling, from the days when I had such a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's spend some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY There follows a video depicting the results of Alex's and Juliet's spending spree. It opens with Alex seated at the kitchen table talking to the camera, absolutely deadpan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. It's been a struggle, but now the days of worry are over, the light at the end of the tunnel has expanded into a golden sunrise and at last, at long last, nothing will ever be the same again. Alex leans out and the camera foloows him as he presses the play button on a tape recorder. The music begins. Fast cuts follow, occasionally interrupted by out-of-focus shots of the floor or ceiling as the camera swivels round and is switched on and off. Alex wearing several different suits, outfits and silk pyjamas. Juliet wearing several different outfits. Both of them posing with small objets d'art. The expensive watch on Alex's wrist. Juliet's jewellery. Expensive toys. Juliet takes a picture of Alex with a Polaroid camera. Alex holds the camcorder out at arm's length in order to film himself and turns to the camera and adjusts his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Alex Law reporting from the scene of his own life, and you know, I'm so happy I could die. Darkness. TV. Turned off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The music has stopped. David presses the eject button and lifts the video from the player. Alex and Juliet are seated on the sofa, surrounded by their acquisitions, and are evidently a little embarrassed. Juliet is holding the Polaroid of Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we ought to scrub this, don't you? David reinserts the tape and presses record.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you're making us all nervous. David picks up the Polaroid of Alex and throws it down, then picks up a vase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much did you pay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much did you pay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred pounds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred pounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You paid two hundred pounds for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what it cost, David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no. That's what you paid for it. Two hundred pounds is what you paid for it. We don't know what it cost us yet, for you two to have a good time, we don't know the cost of that yet. From out in the hall, the phone starts to ring. Nobody moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David lies awake in his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Hearing the noise, David sits up in bed, then gets out, reaching for his clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David looks down the stairwell. Other neighbours, in nightclothes or hurriedly dressed, are standing at the open door of the flat below. David descends the the stairs and looks into the hall of the other flat where the occupant, an Elderly Woman, lies groaning on the floor. A hand on David's shoulder pushes him out of the way and two uniformed policemen walk past, followed by an ambulance man carrying a stretcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they take anything? Did they take anything? No one acknowledges his question or answers it. The ambulance men emerge carrying the woman, her face bruised and cut. Everyone else begins to melt away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David stands alone on the darkened stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David lies awake in his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Someone attempts to open the door but cannot because there are two new security chains on the inside. The door is forced against the chains with no success and Alex calls from the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this? What is going on? David! David approaches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll let you in. David closes the door and looks through a new spyhole to see Alex grinning at him while he releases the chains and then opens the door again. Alex walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From what? Jehovah's Witnesses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a break-in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Downstairs, I know. Pensioner's terror ordeal: page six. Alex hands David a rolled-up newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it worry you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it doesn't. I tried to let it worry me but it won't. I've worked on that paper for three years. There is a pensioner's terror ordeal on page six every day. Every day. Maybe when I'm a pensioner it'll worry me. Alex notices some more tools and the stepladder leading up to the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's all this for, more security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fitted a lock up there. On the inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that'll come in useful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex is serving on plates from a large bowl of pasta. David and Juliet sit at the tabel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the same stuff you made last week?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, it's different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope it tastes better than the other stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It tastes different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want it to taste different. I don't know why I bother. Is that enough for you? Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Yes, that's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sure? There's lots more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sure, that'll be enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not eating what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not eating like you used to, that's what.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you give me the plate, I'll eat. Alex hands him the plate and he starts to eat. Alex watches him chew a mouthful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now swallow. David does so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you should spend some of that money instead of worrying about it. That's my advice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. You'd feel much better about it. David has stopped eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once it's spent you won't have to worry about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be like a weight off your shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know we're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to secure it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Secure it? What do you mean -- you're gong to take it to a bank? You're not going to take it to a bank? You're not going to take it to a bank Or what, you want to bury it? Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see the point in that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because that's no good. Remember, we did what we did, we took the money. It was a material calculation. But what's the use if it's underground, or in some funny bank in some funny place? If you can't spend it, if you can't have it, what use is it? None. It's nothing, all for nothing, if you do that. I didn't get into this for nothing, so that I could have nothing -- DAVID Yeah, and you didn't saw his feet off. There is silence. David resumes eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It tastes different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex stands at the sink doing some washing up. He hears footsteps from the loft above. He stops what he is doing and walks slowly out ot the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In the darkness we can just make out David's eyes as he sits in darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling from below) David, David, what are you doing up there? The torch goes on. David lifts the bag of money from between the rafters. He puts it inside another thick yellow plastic bag, which he ties tightly with string. David opens the water tank. Alex's voice can be heard throughout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continued; calling from below) Will you come down now. It's not safe up there. Are you listening to me. Security and insanity are not the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT ALEX Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet sits drinking coffee, while Alex sands in the doorway looking up towards the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't stay up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll come down. Leave him alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he's got to go to work, hasn't he? You think he'll come down for that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but he's looking after the money, so what's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking after it -- he's probably fucking well eating it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Juliet looks through the door from a small office out into the main waiting area in the casualty departmet. It is busy and there are rooms of people nursing injuries waiting to be seen. More file past the door while she watches with no enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The trapdoor opens. David's head appears. He looks around and listens carfeully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Lumsden answers his telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David speaks on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my mother, sir, she's very ill and I think I need to be with her just now. I don't know. The doctors aren't sure. It could go either way. Yes, sir, I'll certainly stay in touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David shaves carefully with a safety razor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bacon and eggs fry in a pan. David attends to them while drinking from a large tumbler of orange juice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A Sister hands Juliet a casualty case sheet. Juliet reads it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Painful groin? What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He wouldn't show me. Juliet draws back the curtain of a cubicle. Alex is sitting on a trolly. ALEX Boy, am I glad to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your painful groin? She turns and walks away. Alex chases after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later. But first -- him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Now I've been thinking -- JULIET Oh, good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't do anything for me, but for you -- JULIET Forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He isn't safe up there. If you really cared about him, you'd use your influence to get him down, then he'd be safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could put it somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where he can't get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you thought of that, not me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it -- he'll come down. Juliet walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The hall is empty and the flat is silent. We see the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING David sits in the darkness. A crack of light penetrates beside the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex and Juliet sit at the table, eating in silence. The doorbell rings. Alex and Juliet look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Expecting anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Alex resumes eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you going to answer it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm not expecting anyone either. Juliet glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex approaches the door and is about to open it. At the last moment he checks himself and looks through the spyhole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Tim and Andy stand outside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex, slightly puzzled, fixes the security chains before opening the door. As soon as he opens it, the door is kicked wide open as the security chains break off. Tim and Andy enter the flat. In a whirlwind of force they drag and shove Alex and Juliet into the living room and bind them up with cord. There are no words apart from slightly muffled cries. At the end of this Andy stands in front of Alex holding a crowbar. Swiftly and without warning, he cracks it across Alex's shins. Then Andy slowly puts one one end of the crowbar into Alex's mouth. For a moment he does nothing, then just as slowly again, he takes the crowbar out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's in the loft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The trapdoor is closed but the sound of it being unlocked can just be heard (although not by anyone in the flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Tim pulls the ladder across to the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT It is completely dark in the loft, but as the trapdoor opens a shaft of light strikes upwards and illuminates a small pool around the opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Away from the trapdoor there appears to be a wall of uniform darkness, but then we see a pair of eyes in the darkness. It is David. He stands perfectly still. There is a hammer in his right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Tim's head appears through the trapdoor. Cautiously he lifts himself through and balances on the beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The hall is empty, but we can see the open trapdoor. Suddenly there is a single thud, as might be caused by a body landing heavily on and across some beams in the loft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David stands motionless in the dark, exactly as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Andy has heard the single thud. He strains to hear anything else but does not. Slowly he backs away to the door of the living room, keeping the crowbar trained on Alex as he does so. He looks back and up towards the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Once again a small pool of light emanates from the open trapdoor. Andy emerges into the front of this, crowbar in hand, peering into the darkness. Carefully he stands up and moves out of the light and steps across the beams. His foot strikes something and he looks down. Tim's body lies spread-eagled beneath him. He looks up. To one side of him is the brass light switch. Andy lifts his arm, reaches towards it and switches it on. Sparks pour out for a moment and then the light comes on for a fraction of a second, long enough for Andy to see David's face is only centimetres from his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex and Juliet are bound together as before. There is a loud thud from the ceiling, following by a few heavy steps. Then Andy's body falls headfirst through the trapdoor, straight down to the floor below, landing awkwardly and coming to rest with his head hanging back, looking towards Alex and Juliet. Andy takes one agonal breath and dies. Blood trickles from the side of his mouth. Tim's body lands on Andy. David drops himself from the hatch to the floor. David takes a large knife from a wooden block. Back in the hall he kneels, holding the knife, beside Tim. Noticing something at the top of tim's neck, he uses the knife to lift away Tim's T-shirt. A tattoo covers Tim's neck. David looks at it, then stands up. He walks through to the living room, where Alex and Juliet, still bound, watch him approach. He looks at them for a moment, then extends the knife and cuts the cord in one place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In a scene similar to the dismemberment of Hugo, we see David's shoulders as he saws back and forth at something unseen. He stops and reaches out for the hammer, picks it up and raises it above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN The van is silhouetted against a rising sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN The tools and the yellow sack slide about in the back of the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWN David is driving. Alex and Juliet are huddled silently away from him. David seems quite at ease. A thick bunch of keys dangles from the ignition. Juliet observes them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David sits still in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Alex sits at his desk fidgeting, about to write something but unable to start. On the screen of his word processor is a page mock-up with the headline CATS EAT PENSIONER'. As the telephone on his desk rings, he is startled, then reaches out, slowly lifts it fractionally and replaces it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Hunched over a VDU, the Salesman is offering Juliet a range of flights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: October 15th, direct flight, London Heathrow to Rio de Janeiro, British Airways, you are looking at seven hundred and sixty-five pounds. Seven six five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Air Portugal, on the other hand, via Lisbon, same day, five hundred and sixty-five. Five six five. It's up to you. Catering important?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Air France. Glasgow. Direct, but then you're looking at the wrong end of nine hundred and twelve pounds. That's nine one two. It's up to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the first one's fine. Heathrow direct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's up to you. Air Patagonia. New outfit: via Caracas and Bogot . No catering. Four hundred and eleven pounds. Four one one. Good value, but refueling at Bogot is variable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first one was fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's up to you. Seven six five. How will you be paying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The hall is empty but we can hear David's footsteps on the beams above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex sits watching The Wicker Man on televison. He can hear the footsteps above. He turns the sound up on the television so that he cannot hear them, but he keeps looking up at the ceiling, as though he expects to hear them or see somwthing. Eventually he turns the sound back down and, after a moment's silence, the footsteps start again, back and forth, then stop. Alex looks up. Without warning there is the sound of an electric drill. The blade of the drill appears through the ceiling and is then withdrawn. Alex is shocked. Other drill holes appear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Holes are drilled in the ceilings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Rods of light penetrate up from the holes, interrupting but not obliterating the darknes. David sits back, pleased with his work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet sits at her desk. Alex stands in the doorway. He is about to speak. Juliet raises a finger to her lips. They both look at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Establishing shot of Alex and Juliet in garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The trapdoor is open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David is searching through Alex's desk, looking through letters and folders, then shoving them back into drawers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT ALEX No, definitely not. And that's that. I refuse to discuss it further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I refuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not frightened. A little terrified maybe. Did you see what happened to the last two who tried that? They went up alive and they came down dead -- the difference, I mean, alive dead dead alive, that sort of thing. It wasn't difficult to spot. He killed them both: he cut them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David is now searching through Juliet's desk. He picks up a large brown envelope and looks into it. Beneath it is the airline ticket envelope. The doorbell rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT McCall and Mitchell stand outside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David opens the door. McCall smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening. I'm Detective Inspector McCall and this is DC Mitchell. I wonder if we could ask you some questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about the burglary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burglary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David sits on the sofa while the two policemen sit on armchairs several feet apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I just heard her cries for help and all that, and when I went downstairs there were already those other people there, so I just stood around really, waiting -- you know how people do -- and then when your colleagues arrived I came back upstairs. And that's about all, I think. I didn't actually see anything useful, I don't think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: did you hear anything before he cries?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not that I recall, I was asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen anything or anyone suspicious around here in the last few days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, nothing, sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if you do, you'll let us know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the other three people on the flat, did they hear anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are only two other people in the flat. McCall consults a notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said there were four?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We understood there were four people living here. Not always, of course, but now, four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, three. Who said there were four?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How strange. And how unsatisfactory to have misleading information. Only three people here. You're sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a note of that, Mitchell. Only three, rather than four. Write it down. You can use numbers or words, I have no preference. Which are you using?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. DC Mitchell is a rising star, Mr. Stevens. Under my tutelage he will undoubtedly make the grade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it. And these two other people, did they hear anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they were asleep. They didn't even wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Why do you think you woke and they didn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Maybe I'm a light sleeper. Uncomfortably, David realizes that Mitchell has noted down even this last, trivial remark in a painful longhand and has underlined a short segment of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In the hallway of the flat Mitchell stands at the open main door, waiting to leave. McCall is kneeling at the door to Hugo's room, tracing his finger down the broken lintel and lock. David looks on.

direction.raw_text: Loks like you had a break-in up here as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone lost the key. McCall gently pushes the door open and the light from the hall illuminates Hugo's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this where no one stays?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's right, that's it. David notices that Mitchell is writing this down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT ALEX You'll wait in the hall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll wait there.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything. Except maybe that it was his idea and not mine in the first place. OK? That's important to me. I need to die misunderstood. JULIET Alex.

direction.raw_text: As smart as you are, you'll need a little help. She hands Alex a Yale key. Alex stares at it.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT In the darkness, the sound of the lock being turned is heard.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex tsands at the top of the ladder, holding the key in the trapdoor lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, David, what I'm going to do is, I'm going to open this lock and I'm going to come up, and what's important is that you remain calm. There is one light on. Juliet stands at the bottom of the ladder. Having opened the trapdoor, Alex stops and listens, but there is no sound above his own breathing. Juliet throws up a torch, which he catches. He switches it on. It shines, then goes out, and he knocks it against the ladder, making it work again. Slowly he pushes the trapdoor open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The trapdoor opens. Below it, Alex crouches on the ladder, expecting attack at any moment. He looks back down to Juliet, who returns his gaze, then he slowly raises himself into the loft. He turns around quickly, darting the torchlight around into corners and squinting in the darkness, but he sees nothing. The torch goes out. Cursing, he knocks it against a beam and it shines again. Slowly he moves further from the trapdoor into the centre of the loft, still turning around and worried about what might be behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet stands waiting, braced for sounds of conflict.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex is still looking but has relaxed a little, feeling les in danger. In one corner he notices David's pile of left-possessions and the mat on which he has been sleeping. He moves towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Juliet stands, still waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex stands in David's corner. With another sweep of the torch he can still see nothing. He calls to Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He isn't up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A close-up of Juliet's face, just as David's hand slams across her mouth, gripping her tightly while his other hand clamps on the back of her head. David's mouth is right up against her ear as he spits a warning into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to look for the money. Slowly, David relaxes his grip on Juliet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look for the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex, cheerful now, is looking in the rafters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, that's what I'm doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David holds Juliet across her face again. She is terrified and does not struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Expecting anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you expecting anyone? Tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visitors? Some friends maybe? Someone you talked to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one. I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who have you talked to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I think you're lying -- INT. LOFT. NIGHT Alex stands gazing around the loft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from the loft) Well, it's not up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT David pulls Juliet to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex is about to descend when he notices the water tank. He walks over and lifts the lid. His face breaks into a smile as he realizes what it holds. He dips an arm into the tank, raises the yellow bag, then quickly lowers it again. Alex steps back from the water tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Alex appears at the top of the ladder. Without looking, he slides down as quickly as he can, calling out as he does so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juliet, I have -- Alex reaches the base of the ladder. He turns around to find himself facing the blade of the battery-operated drill, held by David. Juliet stands off to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- a problem. David holds the drill even closer until it is almost touching the centre of Alex's forehead and presses the trigger' to turn the blade slowly as he speaks. Alex does not move at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You looking for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for you? Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for? What did you want? The money? Was that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just wanted to speak to you. Alex's hands and sleeves are wet. A few drops of water fall from his fingertips. Unnoticed by the other two, he slowly wipes his hands on the back of his jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who else have you wanted to speak to? Maybe you thought they'd already got me. The blade os the drill scrapes Alex's skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't know David. David holds the drill back slightly while he thinks. It could go either way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe you don't -- David lowers the drill and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Alex has just woken up. He rubs his forehead. There is a nick in it, where the drill has scratched. He rubs at it and examines the drop of blood on the end of his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALEX'S ROOM. DAY Looking down from a hole in the ceiling, we see into Alex's room, where he is getting dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Alex leaves his room and enters the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Looking down from a hole in the ceiling, we see into Alex's room, where he is getting dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Looking down on Alex as he leaves the flat and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David scurries back across the beams to look down through another hole. He looks for several seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the following sequence, Juliet's face is not seen until her comment on it. INT. JULIET'S ROOM. DAY Juliet lies on her bed. She throws the covers back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David is still looking down through the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Juliet moves about her room. She is wearing a large, baggy T- shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David still watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Juliet's legs are seen as the T-shirt lands on the floor beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David sits back suddenly, recoiling from the activity. He scrambles back across to his mat, where he sits back down and closes his eyes. Then he opens them and scrambles back to look down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The room is empty. The sound of the flat door closing is heard. From David's point of view we see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY INT. LOFT/LIVING ROOM (EMPTY). DAY INT. LOFT/KITCHEN (EMPTY). DAY INT. HALL. DAY David's head appears beneath the trapdoor. He hangs from the hatch and drops down to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David showers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David emerges from the bathroom and walks towards the kitchen. We follow him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David takes orange juice out of the fridge and pours himself a glass. He sits at the table and looks briefly into a corner that we cannot see. The expression oh his face does not change and his voice is impassive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you'd gone to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a face like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Juliet's face. There are bruises across it where she was gripped by David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY In close-up we track along the following half-sentence: In the event of my death I want the following facts to be known:' -- The remainder of the screen is blank. Alex sits at his desk, deciding what to type next on the screen seen before. A young Office Boy approaches his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The editor wants to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING David sits while Juliet talks. She is now seated behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember how things used to be here, and I see how they are now, and I don't know why it is. I don't know how we let you become like this. We were your friends and we should have looked after you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Alex sits nervously while the Editor sits on the side of his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out in the woods. Three bodies. Decomposed. Mutilated. Beyond recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you don't know anything about it. If you knew anything about it, I wouldn't have to send you over there to cover it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there's no -- EDITOR Animals involved? I know, but you need a change. And besides, we're short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've got this story, it's really good, I'm working on, that is good, I feel it could be big, it this, eh, and it's, you know, it's incredible. Am I right, did you say beyond recognition'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David and Juliet are seated as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should hope so. david turns towards her. He reaches out and softly touches her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we can still sort everything out. Juliet takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can try. They look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Several police and unmarked vehicles, including one mobile incident room', stand on a rough track. Another car arrives at the end and is parkeed to one side. Alex steps out. From where he stands, Alex can see towards the site of the burials. There are a few policemen, uniformed and plain-clothes, and a small knot of journalists, kept at bay by plastic tape draped from tree to tree. Mounds of earth mark the site of the exhumations. Alex walks past the other journalists into the woods. He looks back towards the sight, then turns to look in the opposite direction. He finds himself at the edge of a golf course. From the green to the graves is hardly any distance. To one side, Alex sees McCall and Mitchell, hunched in earnest discussion. Mitchell looks up briefly and ctaches Alex's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN/HALL. DAY The kitchen is empty. We track through the kitchen and out into the hall, stopping at the door to Juliet's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY David and Juliet are seated on the bed. Among the junk on her bedside table is the Polaroid photograph of Alex, propped up against a tumbler. Juliet reaches out and turns it away before pulling David towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Several journalists sit close together on plastic chairs. Alex sits at the back, near the half-open door. At the other end, three police officers face them. They are a medium-ranking Uniformed Officer, and to one side of him Mitchell and then McCall, both of whom sit in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, ladies and gentlemen, the releasable and print-worthy facts of the day so far are as follows. Late yesterdat afternoon, forestry workers came across one set of human remains lying in a grave which appeared to have been recently dug. Further excavation on our part has revealed two similar, deeper graves, again containing human remains. Alex turns his head and looks out of the door towards the burial site, now enclosed in a plastic tent. He continues to stare at it. While Alex is looking, the sound of laughter and Uniformed Officer's subsequent comments become muted and we hear the memory of a sound in Alex's head: it is the noise of the saw going back and forth across the victim's limbs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As and when the corpses are removed, we will endeavour to ascertain the mode of death and duration of burial, as well as identification, which will of course be passed on to you after informing, where possible, the next of kin. Alex discreetly stands up and slips out of the van.
direction.name: direction
